alert.note: Alert for Butts; Carroll; Coweta; Fayette; Lamar; Meriwether; Monroe; Pike; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 6:49PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Spalding, Fayette, northern Meriwether, northern Pike, southeastern Carroll, northern Monroe, southern Henry, Butts, Coweta, south central Clayton and northern Lamar Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 649 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong winds ahead of a line of thunderstorms along a line extending from near Flippen to near Sandy Creek to near Carrollton, and moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind preceding rain or lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Newnan, Carrollton, Griffin, McDonough, Fayetteville, Jackson, Zebulon, Peachtree City, Hampton, Tyrone, Lovejoy, Locust Grove, Palmetto, Senoia, Grantville, Luthersville, Flovilla, Milner, Whitesburg and Brooks. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for north central and northwestern Georgia. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for central, north central and west central Georgia.

area.areaDesc: Butts; Carroll; Coweta; Fayette; Lamar; Meriwether; Monroe; Pike; Spalding
